alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 20 at 4:08PM MST until May 20 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Areas along the Colorado River northeast of Grand Canyon Village in Coconino County, Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST /815 PM MDT/. * At 402 PM MST /502 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Canyon National Park and areas just west of Bitter Springs. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tatahatso Wash, Shinumo Wash, LeChee Wash, Tiger Wash, Tatahoysa Wash, North Canyon Wash, Hogansaani Wash, Tanner Wash, Colorado River, and Nankoweap Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
